rounds.event: IBM supercomputer Deep Blue defeats Garry Kasparov in chess for the first time.
births: Alexandar Georgiev, Bulgarian-Russian ice hockey player

rounds.event: The Soviet Union begins mass deportations of Polish citizens from occupied eastern Poland to Siberia.
births: Mary Rand, English sprinter and long jumper

rounds.event: Thirty-six people are killed and 39 others are injured in a stampede in Allahabad, India, during the Kumbh Mela festival.
deaths: W. Watts Biggers, American author, screenwriter, and animator
David Hartman, American-Israeli rabbi and philosopher, founded the Shalom Hartman Institute

rounds.event: Kenyan soldiers kill an estimated 5,000 ethnic Somali Kenyans in the Wagalla massacre.
births: Greg Bird, Australian rugby league player

rounds.event: The Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng launches the failed Yên Bái mutiny in hope of overthrowing French protectorate over Vietnam.
births: E. L. Konigsburg, American author and illustrator
Robert Wagner, American actor and producer
